result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Amadou V Crosley Ndiaye not in court, in custody.  Attorney John M Binder in court for Amadou V Crosley Ndiaye.  Prosecuting attorney Megan Marie Newport in court for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for plea and sentencing. Defendant was not produced. Case adjourned. Case remains calendared in Br 4.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defense counsel called the Court this morning in regard to today's court date. Defense advised the Court a new court date had been set. Upon review, correction to Court date made. Case set for plea and sentencing on 9/26/2022 at 1:30pm.
Letter to the Court.

Attorney John M Binder in court, defendant Amadou V Crosley Ndiaye not in court, in custody.  Megan Marie Newport appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for status conference. Defense requests projected plea and sentencing date. Case remains calendared in Branch 4.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney John M Binder in court, defendant Amadou V Crosley Ndiaye not in court, in custody.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties requesting more time. Case adjourned in Branch 04.  Status conference scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Attorney John M Binder in court, defendant Amadou V Crosley Ndiaye not in court, in custody.  Megan Marie Newport appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for status conference. Defense requests more time for review. State does not object. Case remains calendared in Branch 4.  Status conference scheduled for May 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Anthony D Cotton in court, defendant Amadou V Crosley Ndiaye not in court, in custody.  Megan Marie Newport appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means for .  Case in court for scheduling conference. Defense requests more time for review. Case remains calendared in Branch 4.  Status conference scheduled for March 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Amadou V Crosley Ndiaye in court with Attorney John Binder.  Defendant Amadou V Crosley Ndiaye in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 04, Judge Hanrahan. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 04.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Amadou V Crosley Ndiaye in court with Attorney John M Binder.  Defendant Amadou V Crosley Ndiaye in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is not present. Defense to review a waiver form with the defendant prior to the next court date. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Amadou V Crosley Ndiaye in court with attorney Ruby De Leon.  Defendant Amadou V Crosley Ndiaye in custody.  Anthony J Moore appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amadou V Crosley Ndiaye appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
